Record.ClassificationPath: Findings_and_Disorders_Kind/Disease, Disorder or Finding/Disease or Disorder/Disorder by Site/Respiratory and Thoracic Disorder/Thoracic Disorder/Non-Neoplastic Thoracic Disorder/Non-Neoplastic Heart Disorder/Arrhythmia/Supraventricular Arrhythmia/Supraventricular Tachycardia/Sinus Tachycardia/Inappropriate Sinus Tachycardia
Record.Description: Inappropriate sinus tachycardia (IST) is a rare form of supraventricular tachycardia involving the sinus node, in which a patient has an abnormally high heart rate, occurring both at rest and in response to stressors (such as physical activity).
